title.narrative: PREVENTION AND RESPONSE TO VAC & GBV

description.narrative: Strengthened capacities, multi-sectoral programs, services and evidence-base for prevention and response to Violence against Children (VaC) & Gender Based Violence (GBV) and for creating a safe and protective environment for children., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, social services, the child protection system and the administration of justice more effectively prevent violence, protect child victims and ensure access to timely remedy to child participants in judicial procedures, including in humanitarian situations

participating-org.narrative: REGIONAL DIRECTORATE FOR SOCIAL ASSISTANCE STARA ZAGORA

related-activity.ref: 0570/A0/05/003 PREVENTION OF VIOLENCE AND ACCESS TO JUSTICE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened capacities, multi-sectoral programs, services and evidence-base for prevention and response to Violence against Children (VaC) & Gender Based Violence (GBV) and for creating a safe and protective environment for children.

description.narrative: Maintaining the focus on strengthening partnerships and national capacity on preventing and responding to violence against children through evidence generation on data, prevalence, knowledge, attitudes and practices on VAC; developing integrated services for children victims and witnesses of violence and crime; promoting and advocating INSPIRE package and the Global Partnership to End Violence Against Children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/12/2019
